page.title: 04The Ecology of Coombe Pool.
page.content: Coombe Pool is an important part of local history. It was dug out by men when Capability Brown designed the new landscape of Coombe Park over 200 years ago. Only fishermen are usually allowed around the pool because it is a nature reserve. Fishermen say that the pool is well stocked with roach, tench, perch, pike, bream, carp and zander, but the fish are overfed and difficult to catch. There is a heronry on the North side and we have seen Canada Geese,Great Crested Grebes,Mallards,Tufted Ducks, Pochards,Swans,Pheasants,Owls,Wood Pigeons,Wrens,woodpeckers,Tits and Finches. Fishermen say they have seen these animals - fox,rabbit,squirrel,brown rats,water voles and hedgehogs. More trees are going to be planted around the west side of the pool soon.
